_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average height above sea level of the GCU.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: *Height above sea level* in *meters* extracted from the [Digital Elevation Model](https://www.eea.europa.eu/en/datahub/datahubitem-view/d08852bc-7b5f-4835-a776-08362e2fbf4b) (EU-DEM Copernicus Land Monitoring Service 25 meter resolution dataset). The *average* is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries.  Beware that for some GCU (i) there are no shapefile available so that the average elvevation over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken (ii) it may happen that GCU visited by the wield team (WP2) does not fall in the shapefile available on EUFGIS, this mismatch is reported.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Standard deviation of average height above sea level of the GCU.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Standard deviation of height above sea level, extracted from the Digital Elevation Model (EU-DEM Copernicus Land Monitoring Service 25 meter resolution dataset), for the referenced GCU geometry.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average slope of the GCU.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: *Slope* in *degrees* extracted from the [Digital Elevation Model](https://www.eea.europa.eu/en/datahub/datahubitem-view/d08852bc-7b5f-4835-a776-08362e2fbf4b) (EU-DEM Copernicus Land Monitoring Service 25 meter resolution dataset). The *average* is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries.  Beware that for some GCU (i) there are no shapefile available so that the average elvevation over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken (ii) it may happen that GCU visited by the wield team (WP2) does not fall in the shapefile available on EUFGIS, this mismatch is reported.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average aspect of the GCU.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: *Aspect* in *degrees* extracted from the [Digital Elevation Model](https://www.eea.europa.eu/en/datahub/datahubitem-view/d08852bc-7b5f-4835-a776-08362e2fbf4b) (EU-DEM Copernicus Land Monitoring Service 25 meter resolution dataset). The *average* is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries.  Beware that for some GCU (i) there are no shapefile available so that the average elvevation over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken (ii) it may happen that GCU visited by the wield team (WP2) does not fall in the shapefile available on EUFGIS, this mismatch is reported.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Elevation assessed in the circular plot with the GPS Garmin 64s.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: See the WP2 protocol for more information.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Slope assessed in the circular plot with the clinometer, see the WP2 protocol for more information.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The slope is measured in the plot area defined with the circular boundaries (15m of radiius).

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Aspect assessed in the circular plot with the clinometer, see the WP2 protocol for more information.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The aspect is measured in the plot area defined with the circular boundaries (15m of radiius).

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Micro-topography is assessed at the scale of the plot according to an index ranging from 1 to 3.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The index allows to determine whether there is more in- or outflow of water. See the WP2 protocol for more information.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Land Surface Temperature (skin temperature)of the GCU.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed *monthly average* land surface temperature in *Kelvin*. The monthly average is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries. Beware that for some GCU (i) there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual mean of GCU averaged Land surface temperature

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the remotely sensed annual mean land surface temperature.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between remotely sensed annual mean land surface temperature of the GCU and time (Â°C/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Land Surface Temperature (skin temperature) of the GCU during summer month.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed *maximum monthly land surface temperature* in *Â°C*. The average of the maximum values of the GCU area is computed for the polygon foot print of GCU boundaries. Beware that for some GCU (i) there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in GCU Max Land surface temperature

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the remotely sensed max land surface temperature.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Slope the relationship between remotely sensed maximum land surface temperature of the GCU and time (K/month).

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average GCU Normalized Difference Vegetation Index.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed monthly average GCU Normalized Difference Vegetation Index. The average is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries. Beware that for some GCU (i) there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual mean of GCU averaged NDVI

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual mean remotely sensed NDVI.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly mean remotely sensed NDVI over the GCU and time (NDVI/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Maximum GCU Normalized Difference Vegetation Index.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed monthly maximum GCU Normalized Difference Vegetation Index. The average of the maximum values is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries. Beware that for some GCU (i) there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual max of monthly GCU averaged NDVI

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual maximal of monthly remotely sensed NDVI

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly maximum of monthly remotely sensed NDVI over the GCU and time (NDVI/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average GCU Leaf Area Index.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed monthly average GCU Leaf Area Index. The average is calculated for the GCU area defined with the shapefile of GCU boundaries. Beware that for some GCU there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual mean of GCU averaged LAI

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual mean remotely sensed LAI

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly mean remotely sensed LAI over the GCU and time  (LAI/year).

Beware that  for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land  surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Annual maximum of monthly GCU averaged LAI

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Annual maximum of monthly GCU averaged Leaf Area Index.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Remotely sensed annual maximum of the monthly GCU averaged Leaf Area Index over the GCU Polygon when the polygon is available.

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefiles available so that the maximum Leaf Area Index over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is callculated.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual maximum of monthly GCU averaged LAI

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual max of monthly remotely sensed LAI.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly maximum of monthly remotely sensed LAI over the GCU and time (LAI/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average GCU Gross Primary Productivity.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed monthly average GCU Gross Primary Productivity in kg of C/m2.The average is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries. Beware that for some GCU there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the remotely sensed GPP.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Slope the relationship between remotely sensed biomass of the GCU and time (Kg C/m2/month).

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average of the Annual Sum of Gross Primary Productivity.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed average of the annual sum of GCU Gross Primary Productivity in kg of C/m2.The monthly average is first calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries. Then the sum is realised for all month of a year and divided by the number of year in the time series (2003-2021 here). Beware that for some GCU there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual sum of GCU averaged GPP

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual sum remotely sensed GPP.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly sum remotely sensed biomass of the GCU and time (Kg C/m2/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual max of monthly GCU averaged GPP

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual max of monthly remotely sensed GPP.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly max of monthly remotely sensed biomass of the GCU and time (Kg C/m2/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average GCU Normalized Difference Water Index.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed monthly average GCU Normalized Difference Water Index. The average is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon of GCU boundaries. Beware that for some GCU there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual mean of GCU averaged NDWI

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual mean remotely sensed NDWI.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly mean remotely sensed NDWI over the GCU and time (NDWI/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in annual maximum of monthly GCU averaged NDWI

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the annual max of monthly remotely sensed NDWI.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
Slope of the relationship between yearly maximum of monthly remotely sensed NDWI over the GCU and time (NDWI/year).

Beware that for some GCUs there are no shapefile available so that the average Land surface temperature over a 5 km buffer around the GCU coordinate is taken.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Average GCU above-ground biomass.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Remotely sensed average GCU above-ground biomass in t/ha. The average is calculated for the GCU area defined with the polygon (shapefile) of GCU boundaries. If the polygon is not available, the beam falling if a 5km buffer around the coordinate of the GCU is taken.

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Trend (temporal dynamics) in Average GCU Biomass

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Temporal trends of the remotely sensed average biomass.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Slope the relationship between remotely sensed biomass of the GCU and time (t/ha/year).

_title.iso_639_3_eng: Area of the GCU foot print

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Area of the GCU foot print computed from the shapefile.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Beware that for some GCU there are no shapefile available in which case NA is reported here.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Vertical distance from soil surface to the bottom of the excavated pit or of the auger core.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Soil depth is determined either by excavating a pit or by extrating a soil core using an auger down to the depth where rocks are found and extracting further soil is impossible - Stand level data.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Land cover classification with 2 thematic classes (Broadleaved / Coniferous).

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
The [Copernicus DLT](https://land.copernicus.eu/pan-european/high-resolution-layers/forests/dominant-leaf-type/status-maps/dominant-leaf-type-2018?tab=mapview) raster product provides a basic land cover classification with 3 thematic classes (All *non-tree covered areas* / *Broadleaved* / *Coniferous*) at 10m spatial resolution and covers the full of EEA39 area. The data refers to the unit polygons and the value is obtained by a mode reducer.

In this dataset we only track *Broadleaved*  and *Coniferous*, *non-tree covered* areas are not tracked.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Relative humidity (RH) refers to the moisture content (i.e., water vapor) of the atmosphere, expressed as a percentage of the amount of moisture that can be retained by the atmosphere (moisture-holding capacity) at a given temperature and pressure without condensation.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Relative humidity is [calculated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dew_point) using the temperature and the dewpoint temperature at 2 meters above surface.
